program.name: Middle-Income Rental Program
program.description:
The Middle-Income housing pool provides opportunities for households to rent an income-restricted "middle-income" apartment in Cambridge through privately owned buildings, with rents set to be affordable based on your income.

To qualify, you must:
- Be a current Cambridge resident
- Have household gross income between 80% and 120% of Area Median Income (AMI)
- Have liquid assets at or below $100,000

Note: Additional asset flexibility may exist for households where all members are 62 or older or have disabilities.

This is a waiting pool, not a guaranteed rental unit. Applicants may face long waits depending on unit availability and waiting pool position.
program.estimated_delivery_time: Variable (months to years depending on waitlist position and unit availability)
program.website_description: Income-restricted rental apartments for Cambridge residents with income between 80% and 120% AMI

warning_message.message: This is a waiting pool, not a guaranteed rental unit. Applicants may face long waits depending on unit availability.

documents.text: Proof of household size (lease, tax return/W-2s, birth certificates)
Proof of Cambridge residency (lease, utility bill)
Proof of identity (ex: driver's license, official state ID card)
